Question.Text: A 45-Year-Old Man from Sri Lanka With fever, headache, body aches and constant right-sided abdominal pain for a week. He also has a dry cough. His past medical history is unremarkable, but he consumes local alcohol. He is febrile with tender hepatomegaly and intercostal tenderness on the right.

Answer: Amoebic liver abscess - The patient from Sri Lanka with alcohol consumption presents with fever, right upper quadrant pain, tender hepatomegaly, and dry cough. The images show large liver abscess with 'anchovy paste' appearance on gross pathology and Entamoeba histolytica trophozoites with ingested RBCs. Amoebic liver abscess typically presents with right lobe involvement, point tenderness, and may have pleuropulmonary symptoms from diaphragmatic irritation.
